intro: In order use a telescope's observing time you must make a booking. Then, when the time comes, you will have the telescope all to yourself. Each telescope owner sets the availability of their telescope. We then allocate intervals of 15 minutes during the available times.

solar.name: Solar experiment
solar.desc: Explore the Sun and its spots

three.p1: Once you have chosen your experiment and the telescope, the next step is to choose the specific day when you want to run it.
three.p2: To allow everyone to get time, there is a maximum of 2 reservations per 7 days. We will be reviewing this restriction as we go, learning from you.
three.p3: Click on one of the available days to continue.

four.p1: On the left timeslots that are available for the selected day will be shown. Click on one to see a summary of your reservation.
four.p2: If everything is correct, you just have to apply and wait for confirmation.
four.noslot: There is no timeslot available for that day
four.notime: You have reached your maximum observing time
four.done: Your new reservation has been accepted. Check it

what.title: What?
what.text: You are trying to book time to use @{p1}@ with the @{p2}@ experiment.

when.title: When?
when.text: Want to request time between @{p1}@ UT and @{p2}@ UT.
